problems.title: PowerMate Brush Not Spinning
problems.description: The canister is running but the floor head brush isn't turning.
possible_causes: Belt broken (rare on this model, usually direct drive)
solution_steps: Press the red RESET button on top of the nozzle.
Wipe the metal pins on the wand and handle connection.
Check for hair wrapped around the brush.

problems.title: Loss of Suction / Change Bag Light
problems.description: Vacuum feels weak or indicator is orange.
possible_causes: Bag is full (HEPA bags fill up fast)
solution_steps: Replace the Type Q HEPA bag. Do not reuse bags.
Clean the foam filter behind the bag.
Drop a coin down the hose to check for blockages.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a 600 Series Friendly Pop-N-Go Canister?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $316 vacuum, and extending the life of your Kenmore is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my 600 Series Friendly Pop-N-Go Canister needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include intermittent power and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my 600 Series Friendly Pop-N-Go Canister myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
